name: Portulaca giuliettiae
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.270.2.3 the epithet honors Dr. Ana Maria Giulietti Harley a Botanist who encouraged taxonomic studies on various plant families in Brazil, including Portulacaceae

name: Portulaca glazioviana
reference: Comun. Bot. Mus. Hist. Nat. Montevideo 2, (no. 27): 7, tab. 4. 1953
publication: Comun. Bot. Mus. Hist. Nat. Montevideo

name: Portulaca goiasensis
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.270.2.3 The epithet refers to the geographical distribution of this new species, here considered as endemic to the Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás, in central Brazil

name: Portulaca hirsutissima
remarks: See also in: Fl. Bras. Merid. (A. St.-Hil.). 2(15): 191 (-192; t. 114) (1830).

name: Portulaca hoehnei
